availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Richard Cohorn (Scott County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Cohorn. Father of Susan Cohorn, Fannie Cohorn, Hannah Cohorn, and John F. Cohorn. Blacksmith in Scott County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 72.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Peaks Mill District, p. 29.
Find A Grave, "John Richard Cohorn (September 3, 1833-December 26, 1904)," Memorial #28579662, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28579662 (accessed April 26, 2018).
